definition: by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc

sentences.english: The unscrupulous governor attempted to sabotage the Roon Colonial Games.
sentences.chinese: 這位不擇手段的總督企圖破壞魯恩殖民地運動會。

sentences.english: Programs will do almost anything for good ratings.
sentences.chinese: 各個節目爲了高的收視率，幾乎不擇手段。

sentences.english: Sherry says that she would do anything to protect her family.
sentences.chinese: 雪莉說，她會不擇手段來保衛她的家人。

sentences.english: They jockey for the leaderships of the party.
sentences.chinese: 他們不擇手段謀取黨的領導權。

sentences.english: Tobacconists everywhere stick at nothing to promote the sale of their coffin nails.
sentences.chinese: 各地菸草商都不擇手段推銷他們的香菸。

sentences.english: But OFHEO supporters say the agency had to play hardball.
sentences.chinese: 但支持督察局的人說，督察局必須不擇手段。

definition: to be greedy in getting money
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
